description: A skilled nursing facility's (SNF's) national rank among eligible, included SNFs in the SNF VBP Program. Calculated by sorting and ranking all eligible, included SNFs' performance scores. Lower ranks reflect better performance. Any SNFs with equal performance scores each receive the best (that is, lowest) rank within the tie.
Footnote for the SNF VBP Program Ranking
Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) Certification Number (CCN)
Provider name
Provider address
Provider city/town
Provider state (2-digit postal code abbreviation)
Provider ZIP code

fieldName: Baseline Period: FY 2019 Risk-Standardized Readmission Rate
cmsColumnHeader: Baseline Period: FY 2019 Risk-Standardized Readmission Rate
description: A SNF's rate of unplanned readmissions during the baseline period (FY 2019), adjusted for stay-level risk factors such as clinical characteristics and comorbidities, as calculated by the SNF 30-Day All-Cause Readmission Measure (SNFRM).

fieldName: Footnote -- Baseline Period: FY 2019 Risk-Standardized Readmission Rate
cmsColumnHeader: Footnote -- Baseline Period: FY 2019 Risk-Standardized Readmission Rate
description: Footnote for the Baseline Period: FY 2019 Risk-Standardized Readmission Rate

fieldName: Performance Period: FY 2023 Risk-Standardized Readmission Rate
cmsColumnHeader: Performance Period: FY 2023 Risk-Standardized Readmission Rate
description: A SNF's rate of unplanned readmissions during the performance period (FY 2023), adjusted for stay-level risk factors such as clinical characteristics and comorbidities, as calculated by the SNFRM.

fieldName: Footnote -- Performance Period: FY 2023 Risk-Standardized Readmission Rate
cmsColumnHeader: Footnote -- Performance Period: FY 2023 Risk-Standardized Readmission Rate
description: Footnote for the Performance Period: FY 2023 Risk-Standardized Readmission Rate

A calculation of how well a SNF performed during the performance period (FY 2023) compared with national SNF performance during the baseline period (FY 2019). Scores range from 0 to 100, with higher scores indicating better performance.
Footnote for the Achievement Score
A calculation of how much a SNF has improved from the baseline period (FY 2019) to the performance period (FY 2023). Scores range from 0 to 90, with higher scores indicating better performance.
Footnote for the Improvement Score

The higher of a SNF's achievement score and improvement score. Scores range from 0 to 100, with higher scores indicating better performance. CMS uses this score to calculate incentive payment multipliers for the SNF VBP Program.
Footnote for the Performance Score

A multiplier assigned to a SNF based on its performance in the SNF VBP Program. When payments are made to a SNF's Medicare fee-for-service (FFS) Part A claims in FY 2025, CMS multiplies the SNF's adjusted federal per diem rate by this multiplier.
Footnote for the Incentive Payment Multiplier
